column2: Optimal policy            :            Forecast the expected future and choose an ‘optimal’ policy for that future.
column3: Forecasting:             Single reliable forecast based on trend extrapolation and expert judgement, in combination with a sensitivity analysis.

column2: Risk-based policy            :            Use probabilities to optimize policy in accordance with the risk attitude of the policymaker.
column3: Probabilistic forecast:             Probabilistic forecasts, for which the likelihood of all relevant parameters can be expressed in terms of probabilities.

column1: Level 3            :            A limited, bounded set of plausible futures.
column2: Static robust policy            :            Identify plausible futures and find a policy that works acceptably across most of them.
column3: Foresight            :            Limited range of scenarios that is intended to explore the envelope of plausible future developments, based on an ever increasing understanding of the system and its key uncertainties.

column1: Level 4            :            An unlimited, unbounded set of possible futures.
column2: Adaptive policy            :            Adapt the policy over time as conditions change and learning takes place.
column3: Futures            :            Use large numbers of possible scenarios that are intended to explore what might happen, given our lack of understanding of the future.
